etymologies: late Old English fældestōl, of Germanic origin, from the base of fold and stool, influenced by medieval Latin faldistolium, from Germanic

definitions: a folding chair used by a bishop when not occupying the throne or when officiating in a church other than his own.
shortDefinitions: folding chair used by bishop when not occupying throne

definitions: a small movable folding desk or stool for kneeling at prayer.
shortDefinitions: small movable folding desk or stool for kneeling at prayer
